p:
To infer genetic relatedness, phylogenetic reconstruction was done in PhyML using the general time-reversible substitution model with a gamma-distributed rate variation and proportion of invariant sites (GTR + Γ4 + Ι)
53 . Branch support was estimated using the Shimodaira-Hasegawa approximate likelihood ratio test (aLRT-SH) as implemented in PhyML
54 . An aLRT-SH ≥0.9 was considered statistically significant
17 . The subtype-resolved maximum-likelihood phylogenetic tree was visualized in FigTree (v1.4.3). Unique recombinant forms (URFs) were further resolved by Bootscan analyses using SimPlot and breakpoints identified using a sliding window size of 300 bp and a step size of 20 bp
55 .
